meanings.definition: To fish with the hands by groping under stones or banks.
meanings.sent1: I saw a man guddle for fish in the river.
meanings.sent2: The children love to guddle for crayfish in the stream.
meanings.sent3: Trying to guddle for fish without getting wet is quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She guddled under the rocks like a skilled angler.
meanings.sent5: The old man's technique to guddle was both efficient and impressive.

meanings.definition: To make a mess of something; to muddle or confuse.
meanings.sent1: Please don't guddle the papers on my desk.
meanings.sent2: I tend to guddle things up when I'm in a rush.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to guddle the instructions only led to more confusion.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to guddle the audience's minds with his tricks.
meanings.sent5: She managed to guddle the situation even further with her hasty actions.

meanings.sent1: The room was in a complete guddle after the party.
meanings.sent2: I can't find anything in this guddle of cables.
meanings.sent3: The guddle of toys on the floor made the room look chaotic.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a guddle of thoughts and worries.
meanings.sent5: The paperwork on his desk was a confusing guddle of documents.
